intro: Brachystelma pallidum, commonly known as the pale ghost flower, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Brachystelma pallidum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
